She said, "There are 12 countries in this world that are run by women." She added, "Those countries run by women, in the early days of COVID-19, did better."

175.title: Putin took us down as social media is bad for dictators: Meta COO
175.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta's COO Sheryl Sandberg in an interview discussing Russia's decision to block Facebook said, "Social media is bad for dictators. That's why Putin took us down." "The scariest part...is the lack of access. When we go down in Russia people are losing their ability to actually understand what's happening...We need to fight for access," she added.

176.title: No-fly zone over Ukraine would end war faster: Polish envoy
176.article_body: Poland's Ambassador to Ukraine, Bartosz Cichocki, said imposing no-fly zone over Ukraine would save more lives and end war faster. Cichocki's comment comes amid requests by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to NATO to impose no-fly zone, which latter has refused. Notably, Poland's PM has said that any supply of fighter jets to Ukraine must be done jointly by NATO countries.

177.title: Mithali Raj starts a geometry class when she goes out to bat: Veda
177.article_body: Terming Mithali Raj as the "best" non-striker, India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy shared a joke in the dressing room that Mithali starts a "geometry class" for the opposition when she goes out to bat. "Mithali's cover drives are textbook, she pierces the field no matter how many fielders you place," added Veda. "Mithali should come at number three," stated Veda.

178.title: Sensex ends 817 points higher at 55,464 amid Assembly election results
178.article_body: The Sensex ended 817 points higher at 55,464.39 on Thursday amid five state assembly election results. Benchmark indices ended higher for the third consecutive session, with the broader Nifty surging 249 points or 1.53% to settle at 16,594.90. HUL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SBI were among top Nifty gainers, whereas Coal India, Tech Mahindra, TCS were the biggest losers.

179.title: Sonu Sood's sister & Congress' Malvika Sood loses from Punjab's Moga
179.article_body: Congress candidate from Punjab's Moga Malvika Sood, who is also the sister of Bollywood actor Sonu Sood, lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Dr Amandeep Kaur Arora on Thursday. Arora won by over 20,000 votes. Trends have been showing an AAP victory in Punjab and the party CM's face Bhagwant Mann earlier said his biggest priority is creating jobs.

180.title: Tiger shares video from when he was 'fat', learnt his 'first-ever skill'
180.article_body: Tiger Shroff took to Instagram and recalled the time when he learnt his "first-ever skill". He shared a video wherein he can be seen performing a wall flip on a beach. "Found an old video of me learning my first-ever skill...Gosh, that sand was impossible to run on back when the struggle was real...especially with my fat ass," Tiger wrote.

181.title: We'll change India's politics: Kejriwal as AAP set to form govt in Punjab
181.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal called Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann his "younger brother" and congratulated him for poll win. As AAP looked set to form government in Punjab, Kejriwal said, "People have put a lot of faith in us, we won't break it. We will change this country's politics." The party crossed halfway mark of 59 seats in Punjab.

182.title: BJP leading in 7 out of 8 Lakhimpur Kheri seats in UP Assembly polls
182.article_body: The BJP is leading in seven out of eight seats in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri in the Assembly elections. The Samajwadi Party is leading in Mohammdi constituency. Notably, eight people, including four farmers, were killed during violence that erupted in the district on October 3, 2021. Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra is an accused in the case.

183.title: Russia confirms using vacuum bombs that can 'rupture lungs' in Ukraine, says UK
183.article_body:
Russia has confirmed it has used "vacuum bombs" in Ukraine, according to the UK's Ministry of Defence.
The UK MoD said its Russian counterpart said the TOS-1A weapon system had been deployed. The system uses thermobaric rockets, creating incendiary and blast effects, the MoD added. These bombs suck in the air around targets and can rupture their lungs.

184.title: Working early helps you grow faster: Ananya on starting her career at 19
184.article_body: Speaking about starting her career at 19, actress Ananya Panday said that during her initial days, she felt disconnected from her friends as they all were in college and she was on the sets working. "No textbook in this world...can educate enough like your workplace," she added. Ananya also believes that working early does help you to grow up faster.

185.title: Over 12,000 Russian soldiers killed, 335 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
185.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that over 12,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The ministry added that its military has destroyed 335 Russian tanks and over 125 aircraft, including 81 helicopters. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1,105 armoured vehicles,123 artillery systems, 526 vehicles and seven unmanned aerial vehicles.

186.title: Nothing can come in front of bulldozer, it can finish everything: Hema Malini
186.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Thursday said that nothing can come in front of a "bulldozer" as it can finish everything within a minute, be it a cycle or anything else. "We already knew our government will be formed, we have worked for every developmental aspect which is why the public trust us," Malini added.

187.title: Batting needs to get better: Mithali on India's 62-run loss to NZ in WC
187.article_body: After their 62-run defeat against New Zealand in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women captain Mithali Raj said their batting needs to get better in the upcoming matches. "It was a [gettable] score, provided the top order managed the run rate properly," she stated. New Zealand posted 260/9 and restricted India to 198/10.

188.title: Sea creatures learned to gallop even before land animals existed: Study
188.article_body: A study has found that fish-like animals pioneered the ability to gallop 472 million years ago, even before the complex form of life emerged onto land. According to the analysis, ancestral sea creatures were capable of moving with some kind of proto-asymmetric gait. But researchers believe many of the modern-day animals may have lost this ability during evolution.

189.title: Work on Bengaluru rail corridor-2 to begin by March 31: Minister
189.article_body: Karnataka's Infrastructure Development and Housing Minister V Somanna has informed the Legislative Council that the state government will expedite work on the Bengaluru suburban rail project. "We have floated tenders...By March 31 we will be issuing a work order for corridor-2," he said. The project aims to link Bengaluru with its satellite townships, suburbs and surrounding rural areas.

190.title: Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to touch 37°C by March 15
190.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Wednesday predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 37°C by March 15, adding that the city will witness mainly clear skies. On Tuesday, Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 31°C for the first time in 2022. Meanwhile, Gurugram's air quality improved to the "moderate" category on Wednesday, with an AQI reading of 162.

191.title: AAP to form govt in Punjab as party marks its 1st win outside Delhi
191.article_body: AAP has crossed the majority mark of 59 seats in Punjab Assembly election, marking its victory in the state by a big margin. This is the party's first win outside Delhi, with comedian-turned-politician Bhagwant Mann as its CM face. Meanwhile, Congress has won nine seats, SAD one seat and BJP two seats so far.

192.title: BJP leads in Hathras, Congress yet to cross 1,000 votes
192.article_body: BJP was leading in UP's Hathras Assembly seat at the end of the 14th round of counting of votes. The party's candidate Anjula Singh Mahaur bagged over 59,000 votes, well ahead of the rival parties SP (over 16,000 votes), BSP (over 22,000 votes) and Congress. Congress' Kuldeep Kumar Singh was yet to cross the 1,000-vote mark.

193.title: People of Punjab have shown Kejriwal isn't a terrorist: Delhi CM
193.article_body: As early trends showed AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab, party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that with these results, people have shown that "Kejriwal is not a terrorist but a real 'Desh Bhakt'". AAP has won 59 seats in Punjab till now, according to ECI. "The results are a massive revolution," he added.

194.title: Tesla hikes China, US prices for Model 3 and Model Y cars
194.article_body: Tesla has hiked the prices of its US Model Y SUVs and Model 3 Long Range sedans by $1,000 each. It has also increased the prices of some China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles by $1,582.40, its website revealed. Tesla's Model Y Long Range car's price has reportedly jumped 20% from January 2021.

195.title: Body of missing soldier on leave found in J&K's Budgam after 3 days
195.article_body: The body of a soldier, who had come home on leave and went missing from his village three days ago, has been recovered from Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam on Thursday. Sameer Malla was on leave as his wife had given birth to their second child. Malla had left home to visit a neighbour but didn't return, a family member claimed.

196.title: Will win 20 seats or even 1-2 seats more in Goa: BJP's Devendra Fadnavis
196.article_body: As counting for the 2022 Goa Assembly elections is underway, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that BJP will win 20 seats or even one-two seats more. "People have shown faith in PM Narendra Modi. Independent candidates are coming with us. Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) is also coming with us and taking all together, we will form our government," Fadnavis added.

197.title: No basis to such reports: Akshay on rift with Arshad post Jolly LLB 2
197.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar reacted to the reports of an alleged rift with his 'Bachchhan Paandey' co-star Arshad Warsi, during the release of their film Jolly LL.B 2. Putting the rumours to rest, Akshay said nothing of that sort happened between him and Arshad. He said, "There's no basis to such reports. I...maintain cordial relations with whoever I collaborate with professionally."

198.title: AAP asked Punjab to use 'jhadu' but they took vacuum cleaner: Chadha
198.article_body: As trends show Aam Aadmi Party's victory in Punjab, the party's leader Raghav Chadha said the people of the state had given a decisive mandate. He said the AAP had appealed to the people to use 'jhadu' (broom) in Punjab but they decided to switch on the vacuum cleaner. Punjab proved it likes the Arvind Kejriwal-Bhagwant Mann pair, he added.

199.title: Ashneer's wife criticised staff for amount of coffee, printouts at work: Report
199.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover, sacked as BharatPe's Head of Controls over alleged financial irregularities, "threatened a colleague with salary deduction for making printouts at work", Bloomberg reported citing current and former employees. She "criticised people for the amount of coffee consumed". She also questioned the price of a TV or bike intended as gifts for merchant promotion.

200.title: Salman to start shooting for Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather' from March 12: Reports
200.article_body: Salman Khan will start shooting for his cameo in Chiranjeevi's upcoming film 'Godfather' from March 12 at ND Studios in Karjat, reported Pinkvilla. "It's going to be a weeklong schedule with the two superstars as they will be shooting some action and dramatic scenes in the set-up," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Godfather' also stars Nayanthara.

201.title: Have soft spot for Munawar, it's never going to be two-way: Saisha
201.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who is a contestant on reality television show 'Lock Upp', revealed to co-contestant Sara Khan during one of the tasks that she has a soft spot for comedian Munawar Faruqui. "I am just feeling for him...I know that is only going to be one way, it's never going to be two-way," she said.

202.title: Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten: Butt on Rawalpindi Test
202.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has criticised the PCB over the pitch used in the Rawalpindi Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Pindi is a result-oriented pitch. In first-class matches, people complain that matches end here in 2.5 days...Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten," Butt stated. "It's their weakness in underestimating themselves," he added.

203.title: Unfortunate that Maha CM, Guv don’t trust each other: Bombay HC
203.article_body: The Bombay High Court  said that it was "unfortunate" that CM Uddhav Thackeray and Governor BS Koshyari "did not trust each other". It would be appropriate for the two to sit together and sort out the differences, the bench added. The court made the observations while presiding over two PILs challenging the procedure for selection of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Speaker.

204.title: Congress concedes defeat in Punjab elections as CM Channi congratulates AAP
204.article_body: Congress conceded defeat in the Punjab Assembly elections, with state CM Charanjit Singh Channi tweeting, "I humbly accept the verdict of the people of Punjab." "Congratulate Aam Aadmi Party and their elected CM Bhagwant Mann Ji for the victory. I hope they will deliver on the expectations of people," he wrote.

205.title: 'Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Channi? A mobile repair shop worker,' says Kejriwal
205.article_body: As trends show AAP's victory by a big margin in Punjab, AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said, "Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi? AAP candidate who works in a mobile repair shop." Kejriwal was referring AAP's Bhadaur candidate Labh Singh Ugoke. The CM was also defeated in Chamkaur Sahib by AAP's Charanjit Singh.

206.title: People voted for BJP's welfare works: Joshi on U'khand poll results
206.article_body: Union Minister and BJP's Uttarakhand election in-charge Pralhad Joshi said on Thursday that the people of Uttarakhand had endorsed PM Narendra Modi and CM Pushkar Singh Dhami's welfare policies. "The result was on expected lines. I want to thank the people...for...result," Joshi added. According to the latest trends, BJP is leading in 48 out of 70 Assembly seats in Uttarakhand.

207.title: BJP workers play holi in Lucknow office, say 'UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba'
207.article_body: As official trends predicted victory for the Bharatiya Janata Party in Uttar Pradesh polls, party workers played holi at the party office in Lucknow. They also raised slogans saying "UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba". Meanwhile, a kid dressed up as Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, carrying a bulldozer toy, also arrived at the party office in Lucknow.

208.title: Neymar is a clown and should go to fashion week instead: Daniel Riolo
208.article_body: Reacting to PSG being knocked out of the Champions League after a 2-3 defeat on aggregate against Real Madrid, French football pundit Daniel Riolo said Neymar is a "clown" and should go to "fashion week". "Neymar needs to be fired," added Riolo. "In July, there are the world poker championships. That's what he is good for," stated Riolo.

209.title: Noida Authority plans to build recreational park in Sector 94
209.article_body: The Noida Authority has proposed to build a recreational park in Sector 94 on about 20 acres of land. "Once the draft proposal is ready, it will be put before the authority's board in its next meeting scheduled in March-end," a senior official said. "Once approved, the project will be taken ahead," the official added.

210.title: Fought BJP & Cong: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate who defeated Parrikar's son
210.article_body: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate on Thursday defeated late Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal Parrikar from the Panaji constituency. He said, "I fought the unofficial candidate of the BJP (Utpal) as well as the Congress." He claimed the BJP cadre hasn't accepted him which is why Utpal got so many votes. "The BJP leadership...didn't manage to do damage control," he added.

211.title: 'EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? Just asking', tweets Ali Fazal
211.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal has tweeted, "Do din pehle counting ke, EVMs moved for training purposes? #Justasking (EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? #Justasking)." Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav had accused BJP of "stealing votes" and claimed that EVMs were being shifted in an unauthorised manner. UP's Chief Electoral Officer clarified that the EVMs were marked for training.

212.title: Intel suspends shipments to Russia, Belarus, condemns Ukraine invasion
212.article_body: Intel has suspended all shipments to customers in Russia and Belarus in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Intel condemns the invasion of Ukraine...Our thoughts are with everyone who has been impacted by this war," the firm said. Intel's announcement came after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov urged it to stop selling its solutions to Russia.

213.title: Amitabh Bachchan corporation abandoned me post my film Tere Mere Sapne: Arshad
213.article_body: Recently at Bachchhan Paandey's press conference, actor Arshad Warsi was asked about his godfather in Bollywood, Arshad said Amitabh Bachchan launched him with 'Tere Mere Sapne' in 1996. "I started my career with ABCL (Amitabh Bachchan Corporation Limited). But...[post my debut film]...they abandoned me," he added. "So I don't know what to call them. Godfather or what," he said.

214.title: Remove 'illegal' ramps built outside houses in Vasant Vihar: Delhi HC
214.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Police and SDMC to remove all illegal encroachments, including ramps and guard cabins, from public footpaths in Vasant Vihar. SDMC had reportedly issued about 460 notices to persons who'd constructed concrete ramps outside their houses upon the public footpath. Police is expected to remove all obstacles from a right of way, the court said.

215.title: I'll take oath as Punjab CM in Bhagat Singh's village: Bhagwant Mann
215.article_body: As trends predict poll win for AAP in Punjab, the party's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said that he'll take the oath of office in freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral village Khatkar Kalan, instead of at the Raj Bhawan. "No government office will have CM's photos, there'll be pictures of Bhagat Singh and Babasaheb Ambedkar," said Mann, who won from Dhuri.

216.title: Punjab will now run from its villages, borders, cities: AAP's Mann
216.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said Punjab will now be run from its villages, its borders and its cities. After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab polls, Mann said, "Sukhbir (Badal) has lost from Jalalabad...Captain (Amarinder) lost from Patiala....Channi has lost on both the seats. I had given to you in writing that they'll lose."

217.title: Live heart travels from Mysuru to Bengaluru in 2 hours 25 minutes
217.article_body: A live heart was transported from Mysuru's Apollo BGS Hospital to Bengaluru's Narayana Hrudayalaya Hospital covering 176 kilometres in 2 hours 25 minutes after a green corridor was provided by Bengaluru Police. Two ambulances were used in the process - one carrying live heart and the other as a backup. The organ was donated by a 40-year-old brain dead patient.

218.title: Reliance terminates lease of 950 Big Bazaar, Central stores: Future Group
218.article_body: Future Group companies have received notices from Reliance Industries to terminate the lease of nearly 950 stores due to non-payment of rent. Future Retail said it has received notices in respect of 835 large and small format stores, including Big Bazaar and Easyday. Future Lifestyle Fashions has received termination notices for 112 stores, including Central and Brand Factory stores.

219.title: BJP leads in Assam’s Majuli Assembly seat by-election
219.article_body: BJP has taken a massive lead in by-election in Assam's Majuli Assembly seat with candidate Bhuban Gam securing over 45,000 votes out of over 65,000 votes counted so far. He is leading with a margin of over 29,000 votes over Assam Jatiya Parishad's Chittaranjan Basumatary, who has only managed over 16,000 votes so far.

220.title: BJP's win is victory of their election management too: Shiv Sena's Raut
220.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said BJP's victory in the Assembly elections "is a victory of their election management too". "Congress party has lost badly in these elections. We didn't get the expected results," he added. Talking about AAP leading in the Punjab polls, Raut said, "In Punjab, people got another option and elected AAP."

221.title: It was the worst moment of my life: Zverev on outburst against umpire
221.article_body: Having been put on probation for a year for striking the chair of the umpire with his racket in the Mexican Open, world number three Alexander Zverev said, "It was...the worst moment of my life." "I can guarantee...I will never act this way again in my career," added Zverev. "If that happens again, you should ban me," stated Zverev.

222.title: CM Yogi likely to be made BJP Parliamentary Board member: Reports
222.article_body: As BJP closes in on to register a historic win in the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections, CM Yogi Adityanath is likely to be made a member of the BJP Parliamentary Board, suggest reports. He is likely to be inducted between March 18 to 20 in New Delhi. CM Yogi Adityanath is currently leading in Gorakhpur Urban by over 46,000 votes.

223.title: 2 men accused of sexually assaulting minor girl acquitted in Pune
223.article_body: A Pune court has acquitted two men who were accused of raping a minor girl in 2018. The acquittal was granted due to insufficient evidence against accused and a false statement by a prosecution witness, court order stated. The minor was found to be eight months pregnant in November 2018, after which hospital informed police and a case was filed.

224.title: Protest march held in Turkey against rights abuse in China
224.article_body: A protest march was held in Turkey's Istanbul against the alleged human rights violations in China on the occasion of International Women's Day. Thousands of women protesters marched holding Uyghur flags and raised slogans such as "stop the genocide" and "close the camps" in reference to the alleged persecution of Uyghur Muslims in China's Xinjiang.

225.title: 'One-in-a-million' 5-legged lamb born in UK, pic goes viral
225.article_body: A 'one-in-a-million' lamb has been born in a farm in Northumberland, UK, with an extra leg. The lamb was born in a set of triplets on February 22 or 22/2/22. Five-legged lambs are extremely rare and Heather Hogarty, co-owner of the farm, said it is only the second time she has seen it in her 25 years at Whitehouse Farm.

226.title: Mark Wood's 'solo huddle' pic goes viral after not being included in England team huddle
226.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood's reaction to not being included in England's team huddle during their Test match against West Indies has gone viral. England captain Joe Root called for the huddle after play resumed after a break due to rain. Wood, who was at the opposite side of the ground, made a 'solo huddle' gesture while looking at his teammates.

227.title: Yes: AAP on cricketer Jofra Archer's old 'Sweep?' tweet as trends show its win in Punjab
227.article_body: After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab Assembly polls, the party's official Twitter account quoted an old tweet of England cricketer Jofra Archer and reacted to it. Archer's tweet originally posted on February 20 read, "Sweep?!" Commenting on it, AAP wrote, "YES! #AAPSweepsPunjab." As per the latest trends, AAP is leading in 92 seats in Punjab Assembly polls.

228.title: I'm touched: Chiranjeevi on Indian doctor refusing to leave Ukraine without pets
228.article_body: Telugu actor Chiranjeevi has shared an open letter for the Indian doctor who refused to leave Ukraine amid the Russian invasion without his pet jaguar and panther. The actor wrote, "I'm...touched to learn that your love for jaguars and panthers was inspired by me...Your compassion and love for these wonderful creatures is highly admirable. I pray for your safety."

229.title: Hardik has qualities to become successful captain: GT's Director of Cricket
229.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki said Hardik Pandya has all the qualities to become a successful captain. "He has been part of our leadership group...has taken a lot of learnings from other captains like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli...MS Dhoni," he added. Hardik was picked as skipper of Ahmedabad-based franchise for ₹15 crore before IPL mega auction 2022.

230.title: Bihar government dependent on God's mercy: Tejashwi Yadav
230.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said the government of Bihar is "dependent on God's mercy". "There is no hearing and action," he said. Yadav further questioned the claims by Bihar government that said over 99% jobs were provided in the state under MGNREGA, saying, "Maximum number of youngsters and families from Bihar relocate for employment."

231.title: Liquor prices in Gurugram likely to increase by at least 10% from next week
231.article_body: Liquor prices in Gurugram are likely to increase by at least 10% from next Monday, vendors reportedly said. Vendors added that they were planning to withdraw discounts they had introduced earlier, a day after Delhi High Court refused to stay the Delhi government's order prohibiting discounts or rebates by liquor sellers in the national capital.

232.title: Amazon stops shipping products to Russia, suspends access to Prime Video
232.article_body: Amazon has stopped shipping retail products to its customers in Russia and Belarus amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. The company is also suspending access to Prime Video for its Russia-based customers. "We have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government," Amazon said, adding that it doesn't have offices or data centres in Russia.

233.title: COVID-19 took toll on my body, bones and stamina: Nora Fatehi
233.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi said that suffering from COVID-19 has taken a toll on her body, bones and stamina. "I am just so grateful for everything, I recovered from COVID-19 just recently so I hadn't danced, hadn't done anything physical since I've gotten sick," she said, adding, "I really started appreciating my health and the opportunities I'm getting."

234.title: Kurnool Police organises 'peace puja' of arms & weapons to curb crimes
234.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool Police organised a 'peace puja' and worshipped their arms and weapons to reduce the crime rate. Every police station in the area would conduct a puja to ensure peace and hassle-free work. But no such puja was performed at the police station since last year which made the policemen anxious about going to work amid increasing crimes.

235.title: Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi loses from both seats in Assembly elections
235.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi has lost from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur in the Assembly elections. Aam Aadmi Party's Labh Singh Ugoke has won from the Bhadaur seat, while the party's candidate Charanjit Singh has won from Chamkaur Sahib. Leaders including Navjot Singh Sidhu, Captain Amarinder Singh and Sukhbir Badal have congratulated AAP.

236.title: Russian convoy outside Kyiv has made little progress in over a week: UK
236.article_body: The miles-long Russian convoy of tanks and military equipment headed for Ukrainian capital Kyiv has made little progress over a week and "is suffering continued losses", UK Defence Ministry said. "There has been a notable decrease in overall Russian air activity over Ukraine in recent days, likely due to the unexpected effectiveness, endurance of Ukrainian Air Defence Forces," it added.

237.title: 40 supporters of ex-BJP corporator booked in Pune for raising slogans against Fadnavis
237.article_body: Around 40 supporters of a corporator who resigned from the BJP on Wednesday were booked by Pune Police for allegedly raising slogans, showing placards that read 'Fadnavis Go Back' during the ex-CM's visit to Bhosari. Ravi Landge was elected as a PCMC corporator on BJP's ticket but had quit the party amidst the ongoing spree of resignations of BJP corporators.

238.title: 5-time Punjab CM Parkash Badal loses his 1st Assembly poll since 1969
238.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal patriarch and five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Gurmeet Singh Khudian from Lambi constituency on Thursday. Badal, 94, has not lost an Assembly election since 1969. Badal was also the oldest candidate to be contesting the 2022 Punjab Assembly polls. Earlier, Badal's son Sukhbir Singh Badal congratulated AAP for the victory.

239.title: Bhagwant Mann's mother breaks down, hugs him as trends show AAP's victory in Punjab
239.article_body: As trends show AAP's victory in Punjab, the party's CM face Bhagwant Mann's mother Harpal Kaur broke down in tears and hugged him on stage. The leader and his mother were greeting party workers in Sangrur. "Politicians and bureaucrats should learn to respect common man," Mann said at the event.

240.title: Holder-Bonner stand settles WI innings after a minor collapse
240.article_body: England bowlers faced stiff competition from the West Indies batters on Day 2 of the ongoing Antigua Test on Wednesday. The hosts had an 83-run stand for the first wicket but lost the next four wickets for 47 runs. Later, Jason Holder (43*) and Nkrumah Bonner's (34*) unbeaten stand of 75 runs put West Indies on 202/4 at stumps.

241.title: BJP cadre worked for Oppn candidate: BJP candidate from Panaji
241.article_body: BJP candidate from Goa's Panaji Atanasio Monserrate, who's currently leading in the constituency, on Thursday said, "BJP cadre didn't work for me but for Opposition candidate." Monserrate is ahead of former Goa CM late Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal Parrikar by 716 votes, according to ECI. "If [Utpal] can get so many votes, it's...because...cadre shifted their votes to him," he added.

242.title: It was a dream to be part of MI: Unadkat after arriving in Mumbai for IPL 2022
242.article_body: After arriving in Mumbai to prepare for the upcoming season of IPL, Jaydev Unadkat said it was a dream to be part of the MI. "I think Mumbai, in general, supports fast bowlers. So, looking forward to playing on all the grounds here," he said in a video posted on MI's YouTube channel. Unadkat was bought for ₹1.3 crore.

243.title: Ashneer bought Porsche, told BharatPe staff he spent $130,000 on a table: Report
243.article_body: Ashneer Grover, who's been removed from all positions at BharatPe over alleged misappropriation of funds, "purchased a Porsche" when he was at BharatPe and "told multiple people at the company he spent $130,000 on a dining room table," Bloomberg reported. "They (Ashneer & wife Madhuri) upgraded their modest home for a rented penthouse and renovated another luxury property," Bloomberg added.

244.title: Ranbir, Alia, Neetu attend Rishi's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' screening
244.article_body: The makers of Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' hosted a special screening of the comedy film on March 9 in Mumbai. The event was attended by Neetu Kapoor, Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Riddhima Kapoor, Shweta Bachchan, Aadar Jain and Randhir Kapoor. Directed by Hitesh Bhatia, the forthcoming film will also feature Juhi Chawla and Paresh Rawal.

245.title: Punjab will now run from its villages, borders, cities: AAP's Mann
245.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said Punjab will now be run from its villages, its borders and its cities. After AAP recorded a landslide victory in the Punjab polls, Mann said, "Sukhbir (Badal) has lost from Jalalabad...Captain (Amarinder) lost from Patiala....Channi has lost on both the seats. I had given to you in writing that they'll lose."

246.title: Russian commanders, officials will be held accountable for war crimes: UK
246.article_body: The UK government said that Russian commanders and top government officials will be held accountable for war crimes in Ukraine. "They [War crimes] are committed all the way down the chain of command by all who are involved and these atrocities are being watched, they're being catalogued and people will be held to account," said Armed Forces Minister James Heappey.

247.title: Mumbai-based Kuku FM raises $19.5 mn led by PUBG-maker KRAFTON
247.article_body: Mumbai-based audio content platform ﻿Kuku FM has raised $19.5 million in Series B funding led by PUBG-maker KRAFTON. Others who participated in the round include 3one4 Capital, Vertex Ventures, India Quotient, Founder Bank Capital and Verlinvest. With this funding, Kuku FM has secured a total of $25 million since its inception in 2018.

248.title: Beginning of honest politics in Goa: Kejriwal as AAP wins 2 seats
248.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday took to Twitter to announce that his party has won two seats in Goa Assembly elections. "Congratulations and best wishes to [party candidates] Capt Venzy [Viegas] and Cruz [Silva]. It is the beginning of honest politics in Goa," Kejriwal added.

249.title: Counting of 60% votes remaining in UP, difference on 100 seats is about 500 votes: SP
249.article_body: Samajwadi Party has claimed that 60% of the votes are still left to be counted as trends showed BJP leading on almost 250 out of 403 seats in UP Assembly elections. SP further claimed that the vote difference on 100 seats is around 500 votes. The party asked its office bearers and workers to stay careful till the final result.

250.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer apologises for 'celebrity' remark, says 'will sell peanuts if needed'
250.article_body: 'Kacha Badam' singer Bhuban Badyakar apologised for his remark wherein he said that he's a celebrity now and won't be selling peanuts anymore. "I've now realised that I shouldn't have said it. People have made me a celebrity and if situation arises I'll again sell peanuts," he stated. "I can assure you as a person I haven't changed," Bhuban added.

251.title: Warne texted me 8 hours before his death, I'll never delete that text: Gilchrist
251.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist has revealed that Shane Warne texted him around eight hours before his death. "He messaged me saying, 'Church, wonderful tribute to Rod Marsh. Well done on that sir'," Gilchrist said. He further said that it is a text message that he will never delete. Warne passed away aged 52 on March 4.

252.title: Accept Punjabis' mandate with humility, I congratulate AAP: SAD chief Sukhbir Badal
252.article_body: Amid counting of votes for the Punjab Assembly, SAD President Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted, "I congratulate AAP & their leader Bhagwant Mann on their victory in Punjab poll." With SAD currently leading in three seats, Badal said, "We whole-heartedly & with total humility accept the mandate given by Punjabis...We will continue to serve them with humility."

253.title: Pune Metro launches mobile app for ticket booking, fare enquiries
253.article_body: The Pune Metro has launched a mobile application to help people book tickets, enquire about the fares and feeder services among others, Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited said. The application, 'Pune Metro', is available for both iOS and Android users, it added. Using the application, people can generate a QR code digital ticket which can then be scanned at stations.

254.title: Celebrations begin at BJP office in Bengaluru amid counting of votes
254.article_body: Celebrations kicked off at BJP office in Bengaluru, Karnataka on Thursday as the official trends showed the party sweeping elections in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Goa and leading in Manipur. The counting of votes in all five poll-bound states including Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Manipur and Goa began on Thursday at 8 am.

255.title: Defeating BJP is equivalent to banging your head on wall: BJP's Chandrakant Patil
255.article_body: As counting of votes is underway in UP, Uttarakhand, Goa, Manipur and Punjab, BJP Maharashtra chief Chandrakant Patil said defeating BJP is equivalent to banging your head on a wall. "Early trends show that BJP will come in four states. All women must have voted for BJP and men might have voted for SP (in UP)," Patil added.

256.title: Fake news: Russia after Ukraine accuses it of bombing children's hospital
256.article_body: Russia refuted Ukrainian claims that it bombed the children's hospital in Mariupol as "fake news", saying the building was an ex-maternity hospital that had long been taken over by troops. Russia had warned on March 7 that the hospital was turned into a "military object" from which Ukrainians were firing, Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to UN, Dmitry Polyanskiy, said.

257.title: First human milk bank set up in Odisha
257.article_body: Odisha's first human milk bank has been set up in state's Capital Hospital for newborn whose mothers are unable to breastfeed them. Director of Capital Hospital said mothers' milk will be stored in facility and will be supplied to hospitals across state when the need be. "Some mothers are...unable to breastfeed their babies in...initial few weeks...bank will...be boon," director said.

258.title: You've fulfilled your responsibility, now it's my turn: Bhagwant Mann
258.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM face Bhagwant Mann on Thursday addressed supporters at his residence in Sangrur after his party's victory, saying that people have fulfilled their responsibilities and now it is his turn. He added that his biggest priority is job creation. "Why are Punjabi youths studying in Ukraine? Why can't we give them that education here?" he asked.

259.title: You gain one inch, they start commenting 'bhains', 'buddhi': Rubina on trolls
259.article_body: Actress Rubina Dilaik talked about being fat-shamed on social media and said that the moment you gain one inch, people start commenting, "Buddhi lagne lagi hai" and "Bhains hogayi hai." She added that people are inconsiderate about others' feelings. "People should know that respecting somebody's choice of being how they want to should be there," Rubina further said.

260.title: Used to conflict in Asia & Africa, alien to see in Europe: UK Prince on Ukraine war
260.article_body: Prince William's latest comments on the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, during his visit to the Ukrainian Cultural Centre in London, are being widely circulated online. Speaking to the volunteers, he said while Britons are used to seeing conflict in Asia and Africa, "It’s very alien to see this in Europe. We are all behind you." He added, "We feel so useless."

261.title: Mumbai teacher cheated by fraudster who threatened to share morphed pics of her
261.article_body: A 44-year-old teacher of a school in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹3.45 lakh by a cyber fraudster. The accused extorted money from her after threatening to send morphed pictures of her to her husband, friends and relatives. The woman alleged that she had received a message from the accused, following which they started chatting on a regular basis.

262.title: Siachen's first ice climbing festival organised in Ladakh
262.article_body: Siachen's first ice climbing festival was organised by Ladakh administration at Nubra valley in Leh, officials said on Wednesday. The festival aims to promote the glacier as an adventure spot and boost tourism in Ladakh. The festival will also let common people experience the extreme weather in inhospitable terrains and appreciate the work done by Army jawans, officials said.

263.title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway closed for traffic due to landslide
263.article_body: The Jammu-Srinagar national highway was closed for traffic on Thursday following a landslide in the Ramban district, officials said. "No fresh traffic was allowed either from Jammu or Srinagar in view of the closure of the highway," the officials added. Authorities have asked the people not to travel on the highway till the road clearance work gets completed.

264.title: Navjot Sidhu, Bikram Majithia lose to AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur from Amritsar East
264.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Majithia lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Jeevan Jyot Kaur from Amritsar East seat. Sidhu had earlier tweeted, "The voice of the people is the voice of God. Humbly accept the mandate of the people of Punjab. Congratulations to AAP !!!"

265.title: 25-year-old Jaipur woman robbed, stabbed to death by 4 men in Delhi
265.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Jaipur was allegedly robbed and stabbed to death by four men in Shahbad Dairy area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. The deceased was called to Delhi on the pretext of work. According to police, the accused took her to an isolated park, where they stabbed her multiple times and fled with all her cash and jewellery.

266.title: When you are allowing sweat, why not saliva: Rajkumar Sharma
266.article_body: Talking about the new cricket laws announced by MCC, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said there was no need to ban applying saliva on the ball. "Bowlers should be given some liberty. There are so many dead tracks where there's nothing for bowlers...[so] even if bowlers [were] getting a little advantage, it's only fair for them," he explained.

267.title: Meteorite gouged 31 km-wide crater into Greenland 58 mn years ago: Study
267.article_body: The 31 km-wide crater that was discovered beneath Greenland's thick Hiawatha ice sheet in 2015 was formed due to the impact of a meteorite that struck the country 58 million years ago, researchers have found. Scientists took samples of sand from the crater and heated them. Using the argon gas thus released from the samples, they estimated its actual age.

268.title: Glacier slides down in Uttarakhand, covers 800 feet stretch of road
268.article_body: A glacier slid down in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh on Wednesday and covered nearly 800 feet stretch of the road. Road connectivity was interrupted as the villagers and defence personnel found it difficult to cover the stretch. "The route will be opened soon. Central Public Works Department officials have been asked to remove the ice and snow," Sub-divisional Magistrate of Dharchula said.

269.title: Ex-Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat loses to BJP's Mohan Singh Bisht from Lalkuwa
269.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat lost to BJP's Mohan Singh Bisht from Lalkuwa constituency in the 2022 Assembly elections. Rawat had lost from the Hardwar Rural and Kichha constituencies in the 2017 elections. As per the latest trends, BJP is winning 46 seats and Congress is winning 20 seats in 2022 Uttarakhand Assembly elections.

270.title: Wasn't lazy: Bobby on dad Dharmendra's comment he was lazy during Apne's shoot
270.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol spoke about how once his father Dharmendra Deol said he was "lazy" and unfit during Apne's shoot. Bobby said, "I wasn't lazy at all...I had...discussion with (Apne director) Anil Sharma. I told him, 'You can't start this film right away'." "He didn't listen...and it was...frustrating for me because I never...removed my shirt on-screen [before Apne]," Bobby added.

271.title: Cong lost Punjab due to indiscipline, tickets for notes: MP Jasbir Gill
271.article_body: Congress MP from Punjab Jasbir Singh Gill said that conflict and indiscipline within party are the reasons for Congress losing in Punjab polls. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Tickets for notes, workers disenchantment, inflated ego & arrogance of leaders have mauled Congress in Punjab." "The Congress high command should review the allotment of tickets and fix responsibility," he added.

272.title: Now Punjab will be known as Uthta Punjab not Udta Punjab: Raghav Chadha
272.article_body: AAP Punjab co-in charge Raghav Chadha on Thursday said that Punjab will not be known as "Udta Punjab" from now onwards but "Uthta Punjab". "All the credit goes to AAP workers, they didn't see day or night, summer or winter and continued working for the party," Chadha added. "AAP will work for everybody progressively," Chadha stated.

273.title: I couldn't sleep after finding out about Warne's demise: Wasim Akram
273.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, Wasim Akram said, "When I found out about him, I couldn't sleep that night. It is just unbelievable what...happened. I can't fathom it...like anyone else." "Every friend and colleague of Warne had one word to say about him and that is loyalty. He was a very loyal friend," added Akram.

274.title: Rhino census at Kaziranga National Park to be held from March 26-28
274.article_body: A census of the one-horned Rhino population at Kaziranga National Park in Assam will be held from March 26-28, the state Forest Department said on Wednesday. As per the guidelines, all tourist safaris, including jeep safari and elephant safari, will remain closed during the period. The Rhino population was recorded at 2,413 during the last census in 2018.

275.title: OnePlus Co-founder's Nothing raises $70 mn in Series B funding
275.article_body: OnePlus Co-founder Carl Pei's consumer-tech company Nothing has raised $70 million co-led by EQT Ventures and C Ventures. Others who participated in the funding include GV, Tony Fadell's Future Shape, Gaorong Capital and Animoca Brands. The new investment brings the total raised by Nothing to $144 million to date, including $1.5 million from its first community investment round.

276.title: Punjabis have voted above sectarian and caste lines, I congratulate AAP: Captain
276.article_body: While congratulating Aam Aadmi Party and Bhagwant Mann, former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh tweeted, "I accept the verdict of the people with all humility. Democracy has triumphed." "Punjabis have shown true spirit of Punjabiyat by rising and voting above sectarian and caste lines," he further said. Singh lost to AAP's Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from Patiala.

277.title: 3 held for throwing crude bomb during polling that killed 1 in UP
277.article_body: Three people were arrested on Wednesday in the crude bomb blast case in which one person was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. The trio was allegedly among those that threw a crude bomb from a graveyard opposite a polling booth in order to create a sensation on polling day, police said. A live bomb was also recovered from the graveyard.

278.title: Wanted to try hard, prove we could do it: Wood on absence of Anderson, Broad
278.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood said they tried a "bit too hard" as West Indies ended Day 2 at 202/4, trailing England by 109 runs, in their ongoing first Test. He added, "With the void of James Anderson and Stuart Broad we wanted to try hard, prove we could do it...we have to admit we didn't get it right to start."

279.title: CM Pramod Sawant wins in Sanquelim, says 'BJP will form government in Goa'
279.article_body: Goa CM and BJP leader Pramod Sawant has retained Sanquelim constituency by defeating Congress candidate Dharmesh Saglani by a margin of over 650 votes, reported All India Radio. He has sought Goa Governor's appointment to stake claim to form the next government. He said, "BJP will form the government in Goa. We will take MGP and Independent candidates with us."

280.title: Would rather be 'spicy' than someone who's 'pheeki': Malaika on 'sexy' tag
280.article_body: Malaika Arora, talking about being called 'sexy', said, "My God, I really held on to that tag!" The 48-year-old actress added, "It's like, when you bestow somebody a title or crown...you hang on to it forever...So, I guess, I've just hung on to this tag." "I've always said...I'd rather be known as...'sexy' and 'spicy'...than being known as 'pheeki'," Malaika said.

281.title: US woman killed by stalker who attached GPS tracker to her bike
281.article_body: A 21-year-old US woman, who was studying in the Netherlands, was allegedly stabbed to death by a stalker who attached a GPS tracker to her bike. Mieke Oort met the accused, Thomas R, on Tinder and had dated him briefly. The 27-year-old accused reportedly became violent and started stalking her after she decided to get back with her ex-boyfriend.

282.title: India suffer their first defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup, lose to hosts New Zealand
282.article_body: India suffered their first defeat in the 2022 Women's World Cup after losing to hosts New Zealand by 62 runs. Overall, it is India's 10th defeat in 13 matches against New Zealand in Women's World Cup history. The match witnessed India's Jhulan Goswami equal Australia's Lyn Fullston's record for taking most wickets in Women's World Cup (39 wickets).

283.title: BJP wins 1 seat, leading in 19 as per early trends in Manipur Assembly polls
283.article_body: The BJP has won one seat and is leading in 19 other seats in the 60-seat Manipur Assembly, according to early election trends. Early trends also show that JD(U) has won one seat in the state and is leading in three others. The Congress is leading in three seats, while the Naga People's Front (NPF) is leading in seven seats.

284.title: Fans decorate Prabhas' cut-out with garlands ahead of 'Radhe Shyam' release
284.article_body: Fans of actor Prabhas decorated his cutout with garlands ahead of the release of his film 'Radhe Shyam'. Prabhas had earlier apologised to his fans for keeping them waiting. He had said that there would be multiple releases from him. "I will work for 300 days a year to make it happen", the actor had said.

285.title: We didn't want to play into Australia’s hands: Raja on Rawalpindi pitch
285.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said the reason behind the Rawalpindi pitch used for Pakistan's first Test against Australia being flat, was to "not play" into Australia's hands by preparing a fast, bouncy pitch. "Pakistan...had limited resources for the Test and our bowling line up was disturbed as well," added Raja. Steve Smith had termed the pitch as "dead".

286.title: I don't come from a family with a big business & old money: Malaika
286.article_body: Malaika Arora said she doesn't come from a family with "big business" and "old money". She added, "The only thing I was thinking about is, if I am a single mother, I need to be a working single mother." Malaika said that she wanted to be a working single mother so she could take care of herself and her son.

287.title: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann wins Dhuri seat by defeating Dalvir Goldy
287.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann has won from the Dhuri seat by defeating Congress leader Dalvir Singh Goldy. Earlier, AAP's Punjab co-in charge Raghav Chadha said, "Punjab has proven that it likes the Arvind Kejriwal-Bhagwant Mann pair and no other party's pair...all other parties tried to defame us and called Kejriwal a terrorist."

288.title: SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar leads in UP's Zahoorabad
288.article_body: Samajwadi Party ally and Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar is currently leading in Uttar Pradesh's Zahoorabad seat with over 25,000 votes and a margin of over 10,000 votes over BJP candidate Kalicharan, who has secured over 15,000 votes so far. With over 12,000 votes, BSP's Saiyyada Shadab Fatima is just behind BJP.

289.title: SpaceX Polaris Dawn crew members to carry Ukraine's flag to space
289.article_body: The crew members of the upcoming SpaceX mission called 'Polaris Dawn' will carry Ukraine's flag to space as a sign of solidarity. It will be the debut mission of the Polaris Program, which so far includes three flights on SpaceX vehicles. "The...crew will take this flag to a place...that still remains beyond the reach of tyranny," program officials tweeted.

290.title: Indian Oil Corporation recruits 9 Indian women's hockey team members
290.article_body: Nine members of the Indian women's hockey team, which finished fourth at the last year's Tokyo Olympics, have been employed by the Indian Oil Corporation. The government-owned company has recruited these female hockey players as part of its policy to promote sports and women's hockey. Some of the notable mentions are Suman Devi Thoudam, Rajwinder Kaur, Rashmita Minz and Deepika.

291.title: EC lifts ban on victory processions on election results day in 5 states
291.article_body: Election Commission has lifted the ban on victory processions during the counting of votes and declaration of results in five states - Punjab, UP, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur. The Commission said keeping in mind the current status of COVID-19 in these states, it has "decided to relax the guidelines and has withdrawn the blanket ban on victory processions".

292.title: Our fight has just begun: Priyanka Gandhi ahead of UP poll results
292.article_body: Ahead of Uttar Pradesh Assembly election results, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday asked party workers to respect the people's mandate and "prepare for continuing our struggle". "Our fight has just begun," she said. Furthermore, she said that she is proud that party workers "remained committed to public service" despite Congress not being in power in the state.

293.title: Priyanka writes note to UP Congress workers, thanks their support
293.article_body: Senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra wrote a heartfelt note for the Uttar Pradesh Congress workers. Vadra thanked them "for their efforts during the UP Assembly elections campaign despite the party not being a major player in the state's politics for a long time now". She also asked the party workers to stay active at the counting centres on Thursday.

294.title: Despite trailing on his seat, Dty CM Maurya hopeful of 'a big win'
294.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya has tweeted that he is hopeful of "a big win" on his assembly seat of Sirathu (Kaushambi). The tweet has come after Maurya is witnessed to be trailing on his home turf by over 1,000 votes to Pallavi Patel who is a candidate fielded by the Samajwadi Party-led alliance.

295.title: Cloudy sky, light rain likely in Pune today: IMD
295.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted overcast conditions and light intensity rainfall in Pune and the entire region of Madhya Maharashtra on Thursday. The IMD has warned of thunder and lightning as well in the region. For the past two days, cloudy skies have prevailed over Pune and some parts of the city reported light rainfall as well.

296.title: Jailed SP veteran Azam Khan leads in Rampur with over 27,000 votes
296.article_body: Samajwadi Party veteran leader Azam Khan, who is currently lodged in Sitapur jail, is leading in Rampur assembly seat with a massive margin of over 27,000 votes. The rival BJP's Akash Saxena is trailing, having managed just over 4,000 votes so far. BJP is currently leading in over 250 seats, while SP is ahead in over 110 seats.

297.title: Congress workers protest against EVMs as party trails in all 5 states
297.article_body: Congress workers on Thursday protested against EVMs, outside the party office in Delhi as the counting for the Assembly polls is underway. The party is trailing in all five states as per the latest official trends by the ECI. The party workers were seen protesting with placards in their hands. "Democracy is being killed by EVMs," a placard read.

298.title: BJP not afraid of any election: Lekhi rebuts on Kejriwal's comment
298.article_body: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi said that her party is "not afraid of any election" after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal accused PM Narendra Modi of "being scared to hold Delhi municipal elections". The state election commission had recently deferred the announcement of the dates for the Delhi civic polls which prompted CM Kejriwal to barb at PM Modi.

299.title: Sidhu congratulates AAP on Punjab poll result, says 'Voice of the people is voice of God'
299.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu took to Twitter to congratulate AAP after trends showed AAP leading in 90 seats in the Assembly elections. "The voice of the people is the voice of God...Humbly accept the mandate of the people of Punjab...Congratulations to AAP!!!" he wrote. Congress is leading in 17 seats, as per trends.

300.title: Congratulations to people of Punjab for this revolution: Arvind Kejriwal
300.article_body: With Aam Aadmi Party leading in 90 seats in the Punjab Assembly elections, the party's chief Arvind Kejriwal tweeted a picture with Bhagwant Mann and wrote, "Congratulations to people of Punjab for this revolution." Leaders including Navjot Singh Sidhu, Charanjit Singh Channi, Parkash Singh Badal, Sukhbir Badal are trailing in their respective seats, as per trends.

301.title: DMK MP Elango's son killed in road accident near TN's Viluppuram; 1 injured
301.article_body: DMK Rajya Sabha MP NR Elango's son Rakesh Ranganathan died in a road accident in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram on Thursday early morning. Police said Rakesh, who was in his 20s, was on his way to Puducherry with a friend, when the vehicle they were travelling in hit a divider in a bid to avoid hitting a cow on the road.

302.title: Black Panther director Ryan Coogler mistaken for bank robber
302.article_body: Black Panther director Ryan Coogler was mistaken for a bank robber as he tried to take money out of his own account in US. Coogler walked into the bank wearing sunglasses and a face mask. He handed the teller a slip that asked for the money to be counted somewhere else, and read "I'd like to be discreet."

303.title: 2 teenagers arrested for breaking ATM, attacking cops in Pune
303.article_body: The Pune Police arrested two teenagers for allegedly breaking an ATM of IDBI Bank and attacking police personnel. The police found the two accused breaking an ATM at Hadapsar's Akashwani on Wednesday and while trying to nab them, the accused tried to attack the police with sharp weapons. Both the accused, identified as Prashant Kasbe and Tejas Jadhav, are 19-years-old.

304.title: Man wanting a son kills newborn daughter in Pak; manhunt launched
304.article_body: Police in Pakistan are hunting for a man who allegedly killed his seven-day-old baby girl because he wanted his firstborn to be a son. According to autopsy report the baby was hit by five bullets and was killed instantly, police said. The murder has sparked outrage on social media in Pakistan, as many condemned the killing as "barbaric" and "brutal".

305.title: I was deeply moved by Karan's reaction to my acting in 'Gangubai...': Alia
305.article_body: Terming filmmaker Karan Johar as similar to a "father", actress Alia Bhatt said she was "deeply moved" by his response to her performance in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "It was a very emotional moment for both of us," added Alia. "It...feels wonderful to be loved so much," stated Alia, who will be seen in SS Rajamouli's next film 'RRR'.

306.title: I don't care: Shweta on daughter Palak being called 'skinny', 'malnourished'
306.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari reacted to the body-shaming comments on her daughter Palak Tiwari. She said, "Even now people say she's so skinny but I never say anything to her...As long as she's healthy, she's good, I don't care what kind of body she has." "They used words like skinny and malnourished and what not. [But] I don't care," she added.

307.title: AIIMS Delhi to begin booster dose trial of nasal COVID vaccine
307.article_body: All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS), Delhi is all set to begin the booster dose trial of Bharat Biotech's intranasal COVID-19 vaccine from Friday. Only people who have received both the doses of either Covishield or Covaxin minimum five and maximum seven months back are eligible to take the booster dose, Dr Sanjay Rai from AIIMS said.

308.title: Ryzen™ 6000 Series mobile processors for leadership performance: AMD
308.article_body: AMD Ryzen™ 6000 series mobile processors with PRO technologies promise to deliver a new spectrum of performance & professional experiences for demanding business environments of any size. AMD revealed its PRO technologies have multi-layered security features that keep threats at bay, manageability options for any size of an organization & platform validation for long-term stability & reliability.

309.title: Nobody needs your thoughts: British actress Jameela on Kim Kardashian
309.article_body: Reacting to Kim Kardashian saying her best advice for businesswomen is to 'Get your f**king ass up and work', British actress Jameela Jamil tweeted, "Nobody needs to hear your thoughts on...work ethic." "This same 24 hours in the day shit is a nightmare," she added in the tweet. "It seems like nobody wants to work," Kim had further said.

310.title: Sony suspends PlayStation Store operation in Russia, halts shipments
310.article_body: Sony Interactive Entertainment has suspended the launch of the racing game "Gran Turismo 7" and operations of the PlayStation Store in Russia. Sony and Nintendo have suspended shipments of software and hardware to Russia following the invasion of Ukraine. Nintendo has also delayed the release of "Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp" because of "recent world events".

311.title: Bhagwant Mann visits Gurdwara, offers prayer ahead of counting
311.article_body: AAP's chief ministerial candidate Bhagwant Mann visited Gurdwara Gursagar Mastuana Sahib in Sangrur ahead of the start of the counting of votes on Thursday. "We are hopeful that the people of Punjab have voted for change (AAP)," said Mann after offering prayers at Gurdwara. Preparation of Jalebis is underway at Mann's residence in Sangrur.

312.title: Italian man living in Puri alleges defamation, threat to life
312.article_body: An Italian national, Alfredo Rombola who lives in Odisha's Puri registered a complaint alleging some people have created his fake IDs on social media. They tried to defame him and threatened to kill him and his family, he claimed. Alfredo has been living in India for over 25 years and runs an organisation that provides medical help to the poor.

313.title: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh loses to AAP's Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from Patiala
313.article_body: Former Punjab CM and Punjab Lok Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh has lost to Aam Aadmi Party leader Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from the Patiala seat in Assembly elections. Kohli, who quit the Shiromani Akali Dal party, joined Aam Aadmi Party in January this year. Kohli had said, "Akali leaders have no road map or policy for youth of Punjab."

314.title: It was a tough time: Lara recalls rejecting 'The Matrix' role in 2001
314.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta in a recent interview recalled rejecting a role in Keanu Reeves-starrer 'The Matrix' franchise in 2001 and said, "It was a tough time." She added that she just wanted to be with her mother at the time because she was "extremely unwell". "Therefore I did not even think twice and came back to India," Lara further said.

315.title: No water supply in several areas of Navi Mumbai on March 11-12
315.article_body: Several areas of Navi Mumbai will have no water supply as urgent repair will be carried out by Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (MJP) from Friday 10 am to Saturday 4 pm, CIDCO said. The water supply will be cut in Kalamboli, New Panvel, Kalundre and Karanjade nodes of CIDCO. The MJP will carry out repair work in the Feeder Main Pipeline.

316.title: 5 people booked in Bengaluru for acid attack on stray dog
316.article_body: Five people have been booked in Bengaluru for allegedly attacking a stray dog with acid, police said on Thursday. According to police, on March 4, the accused thrashed the dog in Ambedkarnagar after tying it up. They then allegedly poured acid and petrol on it. The accused also threatened a 50-year-old woman who questioned them, police added.

317.title: Satisfied with fight but result is disappointing: Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal
317.article_body: Former Defence Minister and Goa CM late Manohar Parrikar's son, Utpal Parrikar, who is contesting as an Independent from the Panaji Assembly Constituency is trailing behind BJP's Atanasio Monserrate by almost 700 votes, according to ECI. Parrikar said, "As an Independent candidate it was a good fight, I thank the people. Satisfied with the fight but result is little disappointing."

318.title: 'Har Ghar Jal' should be driven by society, not engineers: Union Minister
318.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said the scheme 'Har Ghar Jal' should be driven by the society, not engineers. "Despite disruptions and lockdown in...last two and a half years, we...managed to provide more than 5.91 crore tap water connections," the minister said at a conference on Wednesday. He added, over 47% village households are getting clean drinking water.

319.title: BCB rests Shakib Al Hasan from international cricket till April 30
319.article_body: The BCB has rested Shakib Al Hasan from all forms of international cricket till April 30 after the all-rounder requested a break, stating that he's "physically and mentally fatigued". "He told me...he is not enjoying any form of cricket...we want to give him complete rest and time with his family," BCB cricket operation chairman Jalal Yunus stated.

320.title: Manipur CM Biren leading in Heingang, ex-CM Okram in Thoubal as per early poll trends
320.article_body: As per early trends in Manipur Assembly elections, CM N Biren Singh is currently leading in Heingang constituency. Initial trends also show that former CM Okram Ibobi Singh is leading in Thoubal district. Currently, the BJP is leading in 25 seats, while the National People's Party (NPP) is leading in 13 seats. The Congress-led alliance is leading in 11 seats.

321.title: Shane Warne's eldest daughter Brooke shares pic with him, says 'Life is so cruel'
321.article_body: Ex-Australia spin legend Shane Warne's eldest daughter Brooke took to Instagram to share a throwback picture with her late father. "This doesn't feel real and doesn't make sense that you aren't here with us anymore...it doesn't feel right, you were taken away too soon and life is so cruel," she wrote. "I love you to infinity and back," she added.

322.title: 3 men harass policeman's wife, assault him when he objects in Pune
322.article_body: Three men have been arrested for allegedly harassing and passing lewd comments on a policeman's wife and then assaulting the policeman when he objected to it in Pune. The accused also apparently hit the policeman on the head with a stone. The policeman, who had been strolling with his wife when the incident occurred, reportedly was not in his uniform.

323.title: Kid dresses up as Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann on poll results day in Punjab
323.article_body: As counting of votes began in Punjab on Thursday, a child of an Aam Aadmi Party supporter dressed up as AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and AAP's Punjab Chief Minister face Bhagwant Mann. The kid can be seen wearing a muffler and a yellow turban. Meanwhile, Early trends in counting showed AAP crossing halfway mark in Punjab.

324.title: Positive trends seen in Punjab, we hope results will also be positive: AAP's Gopal Rai
324.article_body: As the counting of votes is underway in Punjab, AAP leader Gopal Rai on Thursday said, "We can witness positive trends in Punjab and we hope the results will also be positive." Rai added, "I thank the people of Punjab for voting for change." AAP has crossed the majority mark with an early lead in 89 Assembly constituencies in Punjab.

325.title: Rohit Sharma is the only player who gave me sleepless nights: Gambhir
325.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Rohit Sharma is the "only" player who gave him "sleepless nights", with neither Chris Gayle nor AB de Villiers being able to do so. "There is no more successful cricketer in the history of IPL than Rohit as captain," added Gambhir. Rohit Sharma helped MI win the IPL for a record-extending fifth time in IPL 2020.

326.title: 'Scam 1992' actor Hemant Kher shares pic of his physical transformation
326.article_body: Actor Hemant Kher, known for playing Ashwin Mehta in 'Scam 1992' took to social media to share picture of his physical transformation. "Here are glimpses of new me! The process of losing weight is a joyful phenomenon! I'm experiencing it every day! And the journey is on! I'd like to thank lot of people for guiding...me," he said.

327.title: EU Parliament votes to end 'golden passports' amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
327.article_body: In the wake of Russia's attack on Ukraine, the European Parliament on Wednesday voted to end the practice of offering citizenships to rich individuals through "golden passport" schemes. The members called for a complete ban on purchase of citizenship by 2025 and insisted on bringing increased background checks immediately. The vote, however, is not binding at this point.

328.title: Tamil Nadu launches counselling service for Ukraine returnees
328.article_body: Around 40 counsellors have been deployed to counsel students who had returned from war-torn Ukraine in Tamil Nadu and their parents. Seven WhatsApp groups have been formed and the students were counselled based on concerns they have raised, state Health Minister Ma Subramanian said. "Whatever humanitarian support they need, we will give...The counsellors will be working round-the-clock," he added.

329.title: Rajasthan is a state of men: Minister on state being at top in rape cases
329.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal has said, "We are number 1 when it comes to rape cases. Why is it so?...Rajasthan has been a land of men. What we can do about it?" Dhariwal later claimed it was "slip of tongue" and said he'd apologise in Assembly. He added, "I've always respected women and encouraged them to participate in everything."

330.title: Alia transformed in 5 minutes, I said she's going to be Gangubai: Bhansali
330.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, in an interview with actress Alia Bhatt, said that she transformed "in five minutes" and that he said "this is going to be the girl for Gangubai". "I told you to wear white saree...we brought you out...put red bindi on you...we tied hair...I was doing Gangubai look test...I said what is this transformation?" he added.

331.title: Can't make a misstep: Siddharth Anand on helming SRK's film Pathaan
331.article_body: Filmmaker Siddharth Anand spoke about helming Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie Pathaan which will be known as the actor's comeback film after four years. Siddharth revealed the pressure is intense to deliver but he loves it. "We have the most-loved superstar of our generation...It's an honour and a responsibility for us. So, we can't make a misstep," he added.

332.title: 35,000 civilians evacuated on Wed, more corridors planned: Zelenskyy
332.article_body: Around 35,000 civilians were evacuated through humanitarian corridors from Ukrainian cities of Sumy, Enerhodar and Kyiv on Wednesday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Authorities plan to open another six escape routes on Thursday, he added. Zelenskyy said the rescue effort would focus on Mariupol and Izyum, which have been heavily bombarded. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

333.title: Hyd police intercept lorry, seize 20,980 kg PDS rice; 2 arrested
333.article_body: Hyderabad City Police have arrested two people and seized 20,980 kg of Public Distribution System (PDS) rice after they intercepted a lorry beside Amarjyothi Weighing Bridge in Balanagar on Wednesday. The accused allegedly used to buy PDS rice from ration card holders for ₹5/kg, transported it for ₹12/kg and earned illegal profits, the police said. Two other accused are absconding.

334.title: This is the victory of 'Aam Aadmi': Manish Sisodia as trends show AAP leading in Punjab
334.article_body: With latest trends showing that AAP is leading in 89 seats in the 117-seat Punjab Assembly, AAP leader and Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said, "Punjab has given chance to Arvind Kejriwal's model of governance." He added, "Today, his model of governance has been established at the national level. This is the victory of the 'Aam Aadmi' (common man)."

335.title: Celebrations begin at AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence
335.article_body: Celebrations began at AAP's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence in Sangrur on Thursday as early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections shows that AAP has crossed the majority mark in the state. Mann is leading from Dhuri seat, according to early poll trends. He is leading over his nearest rival and Congress candidate Dalvir Singh Goldy.

336.title: Admissions for nursery quota seats in Delhi to start from March 22
336.article_body: The admission process of the entry-level seats in Delhi's private schools for the Economically Weaker Section (EWS)/Disadvantaged Groups (DG) and Children with Special Needs (CWSN) categories will start online from March 22, officials said. The last date for filing the application is April 4 and the first round of computerised draw of lots will be conducted on April 11.

337.title: Bhagwant Mann leading with 43,000+ votes in Dhuri, Sukbhir Badal trailing in Jalalabad
337.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) CM candidate Bhagwant Mann is leading in Dhuri with over 43,000 votes, as per early trends. Shiromani Akali Dal leader Sukhbhir Badal is trailing in Jalalabad, while Congress leader Manpreet Singh Badal is trailing in Bathinda Urban. Meanwhile, Congress leader Vijay Inder Singla is trailing in Sangrur.

338.title: Jhulan Goswami becomes joint-highest wicket-taker in Women's WC history
338.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami has become the joint-highest wicket-taker in the Women's ODI World Cup history. She equalled the tally of 39 wickets taken by Australia's Lyn Fullston after dismissing Katey Martin during India's match against New Zealand in the ongoing 2022 World Cup. Jhulan finished with 1/41 as New Zealand posted 260/9 in 50 overs.

339.title: Kyiv Mayor's brother releases NFT collection to raise funds for Ukraine
339.article_body: Former Ukrainian professional boxer and Kyiv Mayor's brother Wladimir Klitschko is releasing an NFT collection to support Ukraine. The collection titled 'Vandalz for Ukraine: WhIsBe x Wladimir Klitschko' will be available at the $100, $1,000, and $10,000 price points and a 1-of-1 NFT will be sold for $1 million. Sale proceeds will be donated to Red Cross Ukraine and UNICEF.

340.title: BSF, Punjab Police recover drone along Indo-Pak border in Tarn Taran
340.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) along with Punjab Police recovered a drone from a farm along the India-Pakistan international border at Tarn Taran's Hawelian village on Wednesday. The BSF troops opened fire at the drone that was spotted near pillar number 124/48 after crossing the border on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday.

341.title: SGPC criticises ban on Sikh staff from wearing 'kirpan' at airports
341.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) on Wednesday said that it's taking "strict notice" of Sikh employees at airports being barred from wearing 'kirpan'. "In their own country, this discrimination is a major attack on...religious freedom of Sikhs," SGPC President Harjinder Singh Dhami said. Dhami has written a letter to Union Civil Aviation Minister to withdraw an order on the same.

342.title: Musk sends 2nd Starlink terminals shipment to Ukraine, Vice PM shares pic
342.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov on Thursday shared a picture of Ukraine getting its second Starlink terminals shipment, saying, "Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" Replying to Mykhailo, Musk said SpaceX has also sent power adapters for car cigarette lighters, solar/battery packs and generators for places with no electricity.

343.title: I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows: Mrunal
343.article_body: Responding to a query about criticism faced by her for her looks, actress Mrunal Thakur said, "There were times when I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows." "People told me, 'You are heavy on thighs'. I simply say, 'Yes, I am an Indian and this body is for Indian wear. Do you have...problems?'," added Mrunal.

344.title: Opposition candidate Yoon Suk-yeol wins presidential election in South Korea
344.article_body: Yoon Suk-yeol, the opposition candidate, has won the presidential election in South Korea, defeating the incumbent Lee Jae-myung of the ruling Democratic Party. Yoon bagged 48.59% of the votes while Lee secured 47.80% of the votes. Conceding the defeat, Lee said, "I did my best, but I did not live up to expectations."

345.title: Immensely proud: Riddhima on dad Rishi Kapoor's last film Sharmaji Namkeen
345.article_body: On Wednesday, makers of 'Sharmaji Namkeen' took to their social media handles to announce the release date of late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film. Taking to Instagram, Rishi Kapoor's daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a post for him. She wrote, "Today, as I watch the last film of my father...I feel immensely proud...Paresh ji thank you for completing the movie."

346.title: Wasn't allowed same privileges as male actors, fought for acceptance: Sushmita
346.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen said she wasn't allowed to have the same privileges or opportunities that male actors had. "I've had to fight as a woman for many levels of acceptance...I'm older now, so I do have experience and reputation which has taken me years to build," she said, adding, "With experience, you are slowly changing the world."

347.title: 2 held in Hyderabad for cheating people on pretext of online trading
347.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Wednesday arrested two persons for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of online trading. They were arrested after a victim was duped of ₹8.2 lakh, reported Telangana Today. According to police, the accused floated fraudulent firms and offered huge returns in a short span of time. However, after collecting money they shut down the firms, police added.

348.title: Tanzanian national held with heroin worth ₹32 cr at Ahmedabad airport
348.article_body: A Tanzanian national was arrested with 4.5 kg of heroin worth ₹32 crore at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International airport in Ahmedabad by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI). Four packets containing a brown powdery substance were found in his luggage which turned out to be heroin on preliminary tests. The accused had arrived from Sharjah on Wednesday, DRI said.

349.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per latest trends?
349.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in 259, SP in 128 and BSP in 7 seats in UP Assembly elections. In Punjab, AAP is leading in 89, Congress in 13, SAD in 9 and BJP in 5 seats. In Uttarakhand Assembly, BJP is leading in 42 seats and Congress in 23. BJP is leading in 18 seats in Goa.

350.title: Odisha CM announces ₹3 lakh ex gratia as 2 die in bridge collapse
