350.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has expressed grief after two people died and one was injured when a portion of a bridge collapsed at Cuttak's Chhatra Bazar on Wednesday. Patnaik also announced an ex gratia of ₹3 lakh for the deceased's families. "We will continue rescue operations to ensure that no one is left under the debris," DCP Prateek Singh said.

351.title: Aamir always gets over-excited: Big B on him crying after seeing 'Jhund'
351.article_body: Reacting to actor Aamir Khan bursting into tears after watching his film 'Jhund', Amitabh Bachchan joked that Aamir "always" has the habit of getting "over-excited". "Aamir has always been a very good judge of films," added Amitabh. "I remember when I discussed ['Jhund']...with Aamir, he told me I must do this film," Amitabh had earlier said.

352.title: Anti-incumbency to increase against Gehlot after poll results today: BJP
352.article_body: Rajasthan BJP incharge Arun Singh said that anti-incumbency against the state's Congress government will intensify after the Assembly poll results today, adding that the countdown for the end of Ashok Gehlot-led government has started. Gehlot makes promises daily but nobody knows how will he keep them, Singh added. Congress will not get even five seats in UP, Singh further said.

353.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reaches counting centre in Panaji
353.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reached a counting centre in Panaji on Thursday morning as counting of votes began for the recently held Assembly polls. Sawant was apprised about the security measures in place by the police officials. Sawant stated that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

354.title: Soldiers of democracy should return with victory certificate: Akhilesh Yadav
354.article_body: As the counting of votes is underway in UP, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday said, "Soldiers of democracy should return with a victory certificate." "Thank you from the bottom of my heart to every single worker, supporter, leader, office bearer and well-wisher of the SP-alliance for being alert and vigilant at the counting centres day and night," Yadav tweeted.

355.title: When 'Aam Aadmi' rises, thrones shake: Raghav Chadha on poll results day
355.article_body: While counting of votes remains underway, Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab co-incharge Raghav Chadha said, "When 'Aam Aadmi' rises mightiest of thrones shake. Today's an important day in India's history, not only because AAP is winning one more state but because it has become a national force. AAP will become Congress' replacement," he added.

356.title: Ukrainian envoy urges UK to relax visa rules for refugees fleeing war
356.article_body: The Ukrainian envoy in UK urged the government to suspend visa requirements for refugees fleeing Ukraine to escape Russian attack. This comes after the UK government acknowledged that fewer than 1,000 visas have been processed out of 22,000 applications so far. If the government gives temporary relief, we will take care of the refugees, said Ambassador Vadym Prystaiko.

357.title: Indonesia's Merapi volcano unleashes lava, forcing hundreds to evacuate
357.article_body: Merapi volcano in Indonesia erupted overnight, sending hot lava and ash down its slopes and forcing over 250 residents in the surrounding area to evacuate, the country's disaster mitigation agency said on Thursday. The agency also warned people living within 7 km of the volcano to keep away. The 2,963 metre-high Merapi is one of Indonesia's most active volcanoes.

358.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant trailing in early trends; Utpal Parrikar, Amit Palekar also trailing
358.article_body: Goa CM and BJP candidate from Sanquelim, Pramod Sawant, is trailing by around 300 votes in Assembly elections, according to early trends. Congress candidate Dharmesh Saglani is leading from Sanquelim. Former Union Minister and Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son, Utpal Parrikar, who had quit BJP to contest from Panaji is also trailing. AAP's CM face Amit Palekar	is also trailing.

359.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami, Harish Rawat trailing as per early trends in U'khand polls
359.article_body: As per early trends in Uttarakhand Assembly elections, BJP candidate and Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing in the Khatima Assembly constituency. Trends further show that former Uttarakhand Chief Minister and Congress leader Harish Rawat is also trailing in the Lalkuwa Assembly constituency. As per the early trends, the BJP is leading with 47 seats in the state.

360.title: Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy to be adapted into web series
360.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy is being adapted into a web series. International Art Machine has acquired the rights to his Shiva Trilogy, which includes the books 'The Immortals of Meluha', 'The Secret of the Nagas' and 'The Oath of the Vayuputras'. Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has been roped in to direct the first instalment 'The Immortals of Meluha'.

361.title: Sitting CMs of Punjab, Goa and Uttarakhand trailing in early trends in Assembly polls
361.article_body: As per early trends in Assembly elections, the sitting Chief Minister of Punjab, Charanjit Singh Channi, is trailing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur seats. Goa CM Pramod Sawant is trailing from Sanquelim seat. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing from Khatima, as per early trends.

362.title: Yogi Adityanath, Akhilesh Yadav leading in early trends in UP polls, SP Maurya trailing
362.article_body: As per the early trends in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is leading by a huge margin in the Gorakhpur Urban seat, while Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is leading in Karhal constituency. Swami Prasad Maurya, who joined SP from BJP ahead of the 2022 polls, is trailing from Fazilnagar.

363.title: Knew I had to take on being single mom; felt scared, vulnerable: Malaika
363.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora said she did not pause after she decided to become a single mother. "You always feel...the whole world is crashing on your head...I knew it is something I have to take on...I have to be responsible...I did feel scared, vulnerable, frightened. But I also felt that I had to take one day at a time," she added.

364.title: Punjab teacher absent from duty for 5 months, disciplinary action taken
364.article_body: The district education department of Punjab's Mohali has initiated disciplinary action against Karala school teacher, Karamjit Singh, who has not reported for duty since last five months. "We found that he has not been reporting for work since October last year. We will charge sheet him under Rule 8 of Punjab Civil Services Rules and initiate inquiry," an official said.

365.title: Want to focus on spiritual journey: Anupamaa's Anagha takes break from acting
365.article_body: TV actress Anagha Bhosale, known for playing Nandini in show 'Anupamaa', revealed that she's taking a break from acting. She said she "couldn't relate to...double standards in showbiz and the pressure to be something that you are not". Anagha added she has been "a very spiritual person" and wants to focus on her spiritual journey and "follow Lord Krishna's teachings".

366.title: Djokovic withdraws from Indian Wells, Miami, says he can't play in the US
366.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has confirmed his withdrawal from ATP Masters tournaments in Indian Wells and Miami due to COVID-19 regulations in the US. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter the country and Djokovic remains unvaccinated. "Regulations won't be changing so I won't be able to play," Djokovic tweeted.

367.title: Issue caste certificate to adopted boy based on mother's caste: Bombay HC
367.article_body: The Bombay HC directed Dharavi's Deputy Collector to issue a caste certificate to the adopted son of a single mother, assigning him the same caste as her. In 2016, the 44-year-old doctor applied for a caste certificate for her adopted son which was rejected by the Deputy Collector, saying her documents could not be accepted for assigning the same caste.

368.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 tattoo artists for drug peddling
368.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested two tattoo artists and their helper for drug peddling. According to police, accused Sigil Varghese and Vishnupriya had come to Bengaluru from Kerala for their studies. They have been involved in drug peddling since 2020 and sold drugs from Kerala and Coimbatore to students at various prestigious colleges in Bengaluru, police added.

369.title: Don't let Ukraine become another Syria, urge UN investigators
369.article_body: The UN Commission of Inquiry on Syria has urged world leaders to work to ensure that Ukraine doesn't become another war-torn country like Syria. "We can only hope that world leaders are doing everything now that they can to avoid a similar fate for Ukraine," said Commission Chair Paulo Pinheiro. The Commission expressed serious concerns over civilian casualties in Ukraine.

370.title: China-Taiwan war would end in miserable victory: Taiwan Defence Min
370.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Minister Chiu Kuo-cheng on Thursday said no matter who wins in any future war between Taiwan and China, it will be a "miserable victory". He added that it was best for everyone to "avoid wars". China claims the democratically governed island as its own and has pledged to bring it under Chinese control, by force if necessary.

371.title: Akshay returns on Kapil's show post rumours of rift, calls him 'unfaithful'
371.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar returned to 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film, Bachchhan Paandey days after several reports suggested an alleged rift between the duo. Sharing a video on Instagram, Akshay calls Kapil "unfaithful". Alongside the video, he wrote, "We all have an unfaithful person in our lives. In my life, it is Kapil Sharma, who is yours?

372.title: Captain, Sidhu, Channi, Parkash Singh Badal trailing in early trends in Punjab polls
372.article_body: As per early trends in Punjab Assembly elections, former Punjab CM and Punjab Lok Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh is trailing in Patiala. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu is trailing in Amritsar East and Charanjit Singh Channi is trailing in both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Meanwhile, SAD leader Parkash Singh Badal is trailing in Lambi.

373.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in UP, U'khand and Goa; AAP in Punjab
373.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Assembly elections show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa. Further, the trends show AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab. BJP is leading in 240 seats in Uttar Pradesh, 47 seats in Uttarakhand and 21 seats in Goa, as per trends. AAP is leading in 84 seats in Punjab.

374.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttarakhand Assembly elections
374.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Uttarakhand Assembly elections are showing that the BJP is ahead with 35 seats in the state. Trends further show that the Congress party is leading in 22 seats, while AAP is leading in one seat. The counting of votes in the 70-constituency state started at 8 am on Thursday.

375.title: BJP crosses majority mark in Goa Assembly elections, as per early trends
375.article_body: BJP is leading in 21 out of the 40 Assembly seats in Goa, according to the early trends. Congress party is leading in nine Assembly seats, trends showed. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's TMC party is leading in four seats, while Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's AAP is leading in one seat, as per the trends.

376.title: 2 West Bengal BJP MLAs suspended for disrupting Governor's address
376.article_body: Two West Bengal BJP MLAs were suspended from attending the Assembly for the rest of Budget session on Wednesday after they created disturbances in the House during state Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address on March 7. The suspended lawmakers are Natabari MLA Mihir Goswami and Purulia MLA Sudip Mukherjee. This comes as Dhankhar accused female TMC legislators of misbehaving with him.

377.title: Game streaming platform Loco raises $42 mn led by S Korea's Hashed
377.article_body: Game streaming platform Loco has raised $42 million led by South Korea's early-stage venture fund, Hashed. Others who participated in the round include, Makers Fund, Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures, Korea Investment Partners, Krafton, Lumikai and Hiro Capital. Loco had raised $9 million in a funding round in June 2021 led by PUBG parent Krafton.

378.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections
378.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections show BJP crossing the majority mark of 202 in the state. BJP is leading in 225 seats, while SP is leading in 93 seats. BSP is leading in 7 seats in the state and Congress is leading in 5 seats, the trends showed.

379.title: Sensex opens over 1,200 points higher amid counting of votes in Assembly elections
379.article_body: Sensex surged over 1,200 points to open at over 55,770 on Thursday amid counting of votes in Assembly elections for five states. The broader Nifty was up 314.20 points or 1.92% at 16,659.60. Around 1,860 shares have advanced, 185 shares declined, and 38 shares are unchanged. Asian Paints and Axis Bank jumped up to 5%.

380.title: Kid in 'Jhund' asked 'how does one cry', he was beyond crying: Amitabh
380.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said one of the kids in the film 'Jhund' asked him how does one cry before a scene. “Kid had reached a point where he was beyond crying. He may have never cried in life...Probably his circumstances and the way he lived...were so harsh...maybe he was beyond crying. That moment stayed with me for long,” he added.

381.title: 2,270 FIRs filed in 5 states for COVID norms, MCC violations: CEC
381.article_body: As many as 2,270 FIRs were filed for violation of COVID-19 protocol norms as well as MCC violation in all five states during the ban on poll rallies, Sushil Chandra, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC), said. "During the ban on election rallies due to the Omicron wave, EC took MCC violations seriously…Every political party is the same for EC," Chandra added.

382.title: Fire breaks out in Bengaluru’s Sukh Sagar Hotel; no casualties reported
382.article_body: A fire broke out in Sukh Sagar Hotel located in Bengaluru's Gandhinagar area on Wednesday afternoon. Thick, black smoke was seen rising from the top floor of the hotel which was adjacent to a mall. No casualties were reported in the incident. Two fire engines were rushed to the site and it took about four hours to douse the fire.

383.title: Early trends show AAP crossing halfway mark in Punjab Assembly elections
383.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections show Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) crossing halfway mark in the state. AAP is leading in 68 seats, while Congress is leading in 15 seats. Shiromani Akali Dal is leading in 8 seats in the state and BJP is leading in 5 seats, as per the trends.

384.title: India reports 4,184 new COVID-19 cases, 104 deaths in last 24 hours
384.article_body: India has reported 4,184 new COVID-19 cases and 104 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,575 cases and 145 deaths. Out of the 104 deaths, 33 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 71 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

385.title: No question of tampering with EVMs: Chief Election Commissioner
385.article_body: After SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that EVMs were being stolen in UP, Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra said there's no question of EVM tampering as Election Commission has always maintained transparency. UP Chief Electoral Officer suspended Varanasi ADM because he hadn't followed the procedures to inform political parties about the movement of EVM for training purposes, Chandra added.

386.title: Proof of genocide: Ukraine Prez on Russia bombing children's hospital
386.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the bombing of the children's hospital by Russia is "the final...proof that a genocide of Ukrainians is taking place". Zelenskyy called on Europeans to "increase sanctions against Russia so that it no longer has any opportunity to continue this genocide".  The attack in Mariupol had injured women in labour and left children in the wreckage.

387.title: Chandigarh's PGIMER to send lab reports to patients via SMS
387.article_body: Chandigarh's PGIMER has launched an SMS facility to update patients about their laboratory reports. As part of its patient-friendly initiative, the patients would now get an SMS on their registered mobile phone numbers once their lab test reports are ready. They can view and download the PDF file of their report using the hyperlink given in the text SMS.

388.title: Delhi HC notice to Centre on Waqf Board's petition regarding 123 properties
388.article_body: The Delhi High Court issued notice to the Centre on Delhi Waqf Board's petition related to 123 properties which mainly include mosques and Muslim graveyards. These properties were to be reverted to the Waqf Board in 2014. The Waqf Board has told the court that Centre is giving these properties to other agencies like ITBP.

389.title: Goa CM offers prayers at Shree Datta Mandir ahead of poll results
389.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly poll results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant offered prayers at the Shree Datta Mandir in his constituency, Sanquelim. This is done in line with traditions set by his predecessor and ex-Union Minister Manohar Parrikar. Addressing media on Wednesday, Sawant expressed confidence that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

390.title: Congress will win almost 48 seats in Uttarakhand: Harish Rawat
390.article_body: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said his party will comfortably win the Uttarakhand Assembly polls by bagging almost 48 seats. "I am confident of Congress' victory in Uttarakhand. Everything will be clear in the next two to three hours," Rawat added. The counting of votes for the recently held polls for the 70-member Uttarakhand Assembly commenced at 8 am.

391.title: Man City reach their 5th straight Champions League quarterfinals
391.article_body: Manchester City reached their fifth straight Champions League quarterfinals despite playing out a goalless draw against Sporting CP in the last-16 second leg on Wednesday night. City advanced 5-0 on aggregate due to their victory in the first-leg. The Pep Guardiola side have reached the last eight along with Bayern Munich, Liverpool and Real Madrid.

392.title: 40-yr-old man sets wife ablaze suspecting extra-marital affair in Chennai, held
392.article_body: The Chennai city police arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly setting his wife ablaze, suspecting her of having an extra-marital affair. The victim suffered serious burns and was admitted to a hospital. On Monday, the accused came to the house and picked up a fight with his wife. He poured kerosene on her and set her on fire, police said.

393.title: Central Railway commuters to have access to trains' live-location in Mumbai
393.article_body: Commuters of Central Railway in Mumbai will be able to track live locations of trains before boarding. Location would be available on the Yatri application of the railways. Field trials of tracking live locations of locals was conducted on Belapur-Kharkopar route. "We have developed...in-house algorithm to get real-time location of local trains," an official said.

394.title: Hung out with friends with Haryanavi accent: Sumeet on Jugaadistan preparation
394.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he spent time with friends with "very heavy Haryanavi accent" for preparation of role in television series 'Jugaadistan'. "I was very scared of the accent...They wanted me to speak in way that is understandable by most people...I had few friends who are from that region...I was hanging out with them...don't think they were aware," he said.

395.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per early trends?
395.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls with 115 seats. AAP is leading in 24 seats in 117-member Punjab Assembly. In Uttarakhand, BJP is leading in 25 seats, while Congress is leading in 20 seats. In Goa, BJP is leading in 8 seats, while in Manipur, BJP is leading in 4 seats.

396.title: Never considered acting as a career; was more inclined towards business: Navya
396.article_body: Speaking to Barkha Dutt in an interview, actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said she never considered acting as a career. "I was always...inclined towards business. My grandmother and aunt were both working women," she added. "I am also the fourth generation of the Nandas to take over that. I really wanted to carry that legacy forward," Navya said.

397.title: 2 brothers force wives to drink 'black water' to have sons in Pune
397.article_body: Two twin brothers have been booked for alleged domestic violence and using black magic against their twin wives in Pune. According to complaint, the wives alleged that their husbands and in-laws did things like making them drink blackened water so they'd produce a son. One wife was pregnant when superstitious activity was done, DCP (Zone 3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

398.title: 70-yr-old patient's gold bangle stolen at Chandigarh's PGIMER
398.article_body: A 70-year-old patient's gold bangle was stolen while she was waiting for doctor's consultation outside the urology department of PGIMER's New OPD block on Tuesday. The accused used a cutter to remove the bangle from the patient's wrist, police said. "We will check the CCTV footage and try to find the culprit," Kumar Gaurav Dhawan, deputy director (administration), PGIMER said.

399.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for cheating cinema aspirants in Hyderabad
399.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs in the film industry. According to police, a victim filed a complaint after he was duped of ₹90,000. The accused had introduced himself as a manager and assistant director at Ramoji Film City and hosted an app named 'Cine Drive-In', police added.

400.title: 68-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of ₹11 lakh by Nigerian man on pretext of marriage
400.article_body: A 28-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for cheating a 68-year-old widow from Mumbai of ₹11 lakh by posing as a UK-based businessman and promising to marry her and take her abroad with him. The accused met the victim on Facebook. As per reports, he allegedly used another person's photograph as his display picture and went by a fake name.

401.title: Alia was a girl, and now, she's a woman: Pooja Bhatt on 'Gangubai...'
401.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has said she watched the first-day first-show of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and heard people whistling in the theatre. "Usually, you don't expect multiplex audiences to whistle...but while watching Gangubai, I heard whistles, screams, yelling," she added. Pooja also praised Alia Bhatt's performance in the film, saying, "She was a girl, and now, she's a woman and she's dazzling."

402.title: Have ensured women feel confident to file complaints: Delhi (Central) DCP
402.article_body: DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan, Central Delhi's first woman DCP in 45 years, in an interview said that there is a need to provide a safe and secure environment to women, for them to realise their full potential. The DCP further said that she has ensured that women feel confident to walk into police stations to lodge complaints.

403.title: Benzema scores hat-trick as Real Madrid knock PSG out of Champions League
403.article_body: Karim Benzema produced a hat-trick as Real Madrid came from being 0-2 down on aggregate to knock PSG out of the Champions League and enter the quarterfinals. Kylian Mbappe's first-half strike put PSG ahead but Benzema's goals in the second half helped Madrid claim 3-1 victory in the second leg on Wednesday night. PSG had won the first-leg 1-0.

404.title: Teacher gets 20-year jail for raping 6-year-old student in Bengaluru
404.article_body: A 46-year-old teacher, Jaishankar, has been sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment and ₹4 lakh fine for raping a six-year-old student in a private school in Bengaluru in 2014. The incident came to light after the minor girl complained of stomachache and was taken to a doctor, after which it was revealed that she was raped in school toilet twice.
